Topic: Draw a fish in their habitat with labels.
Evidence Statements: The student can draw and label different plants and animals, including a fish, in the drawing.
The student can show and label the water as the place where the fish lives.
The student can include and label the resources the fish needs, such as water and other elements found in its habitat.
The student can draw and label the relationships between the fish and its environment, such as the fish swimming in water.
The student can illustrate and describe how the fish and other living things are part of a system that works together to meet their needs.
The student can highlight the pattern of how the fish's needs, like water, are met by its habitat by showing the environment around it.
